newsitem.title: FRANCE: French wheat prices deflated by EU tender result.
newsitem.headline: French wheat prices deflated by EU tender result.

text.p: French wheat prices eased on Friday, reflecting the market's disappointment over the latest round of European Union grain tenders, dealers said on Friday.
Wheat into Rouen was quoted at 895 francs per tonne for August delivery and 890 francs on September-December delivery, down five francs on the previous session.
Wheat had risen on Thursday ahead of the tender as traders bid through France to export over 300,000 tonnes of wheat.
But the EU's grain panel parted with only 155,350 tonnes of wheat at the tender.
"This is not enough to support (prices)," one dealer said.
Although the award was the largest this season, traders had expected the EU to be more generous ahead of a larger than expected grain harvest.
European Commission officials are estimating this year's harvest at around 190 million tonnes, member country oficials said on Friday. This is at least 14 million tonnes up on 1995.
Fob Moselle wheat for August-December was unchanged at 900 francs, helped by fears of quality problems in Germany, where rain is disrupting the harvest.
MATIF wheat futures failed to trade on Friday after clearing their first contract expiry earlier in the week.
